frame.name: Arithmetic_commutative
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame describes types of arithmetic operations and statements which have the commutative property, i.e. the operation is bi-directional, e.g. addition and multiplication. The terms involved are either individually labeled <fen>Term1</fen> and <fen>Term2</fen> or grouped together as a single noun phrase labeled <fen>Terms</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Terms
FE.definition: <def-root>Two more or elements of a commutative arithmetic operation. This frame element may be represented as <fen>Term1</fen> and <fen>Term2</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Term1
FE.definition: <def-root>The grammatically more prominent number involved in a commutative operation.</def-root>

FE.name: Term2
FE.definition: <def-root>The grammatically less prominent number involved in commutative operation.</def-root>
